articles.title: Asia markets trade mixed as banking sector stress lingers - CNBC
articles.description: Asian markets trade higher as they see retail sales data out of Japan and Australia
articles.content:
The recent banking turmoil could bring the U.S. closer to a recession, Minneapolis Fed president Neel Kashkari said in an interview with CBS' Face The Nation.

articles.title: SGX Nifty up 120 points; here's what changed for market while you were sleeping - Economic Times
articles.description: Asian shares followed U.S. stock futures higher on Monday on hopes authorities were working to ring fence stress in the global banking system, even as the cost of insuring against default neared dangerous levels.
articles.content: Nifty ended last week in a bearish mode for the 3rd consecutive week but traded within the previous week's candles range and closed at 16,945 levels with a loss of 0.91% on a weekly closing basis."Th… [+2350 chars]
